Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the only two tax returns show that Trump hasn't paid a penny in taxes, when in fact there were other years where he did pay federal income taxes.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that there were other years in which Trump did pay federal income taxes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or specific details about the two tax returns that allegedly show Trump hasn't paid any taxes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the two tax returns are representative of all of Trump's tax returns, which may not be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for why Trump has not released his tax returns, such as legal or personal reasons, which are not addressed in the claim.
